item.title: Why Some Players Might Never See Elden Ring Nightreign's Best Moments
item.description:
Summary

  • Elden Ring Nightreign has ambitious formulaic shifts designed for online play, but some players might not see its best moments.
  • Progression is a tedious uphill battle, with unbalanced rewards that require a perfect team to reach Day 3 and defeat Night Lords.
  • Solo play is impossible, and multiplayer coordination is limited. Players may quit due to the game's unrewarding, unbalanced nature.

One of the most anticipated games of 2025, Elden Ring Nightreign , has finally arrived, taking players to an alternate version of the Lands Between for one of the most ambitious formulaic shifts FromSoftware has ever made. Specifically, not only has Elden Ring Nightreign been designed for online cooperative play, but its roguelike mechanics are meant to keep players on their toes at every turn. Given how innovative it sounds, one would think this might reignite a fire in those who have fallen victim to Soulslike burnout over the years. However, Elden Ring Nightreign might have reached too far on this one â€” so far, in fact, that some players might never see its best moments.

Soulslike games have never intentionally tried to be accessible to everyone, as their identity lies in their limited appeal due to the fairly uncommon nature of their difficulty, design, and depth. Elden Ring Nightreign was initially perceived as a more accessible formula for newcomers and casuals, with its roguelike mechanics and cooperative framework reinforcing that perception. Unfortunately, it hasn't taken long for that to prove immensely untrue, as Elden Ring Nightreign 's best aspects are locked behind first impressions that it currently has a very difficult time landing, meaning some players aren't likely to stick around long enough to see how things unfold.

Elden Ring Nightreign's Best Moments Are Locked Behind First Impressions

Progression in Elden Ring Nightreign Is a Tedious Uphill Battle

At the moment, Elden Ring Nightreign is severely unbalanced when it comes to progression. Firstly, attempting to play Elden Ring Nightreign solo is a nightmarish slog, as it's almost impossible for lone players to accomplish anything in a session, let alone in a single day of the three-day run. Even in multiplayer, however, progression is still deeply unrewarding. In a sense, Elden Ring Nightreign 's progression is similar to when someone recommends a television series to their friend, but they encourage their friend to tolerate the unimpressive first season because it only starts getting better in the second.

Each failed run in Elden Ring Nightreign simply rewards players with minor Relics and a handful of Murk.

Players can earn rewards with each failed run, but these rewards are far too insignificant to be of any real benefit in future runs. The real rewards come when players manage to defeat a Night Lord in Elden Ring Nightreign after reaching Day 3. The only problem is that getting to Day 3 isn't just a matter of waiting out the clock but completing a major boss encounter at the end of the first two days, and during those days, exploring Limveld and defeating bosses along the way to increase character levels and gain better equipment and items. Add to that the need for a perfect team to accomplish this, and progression in Elden Ring Nightreign becomes a tedious uphill battle.

The Need for a Perfect Team Is a Wall Some Players Won't Climb

Again, it's pretty much impossible for solo players to make any significant progress in Elden Ring Nightreign at the moment, so they just shouldn't attempt it at all. However, running a multiplayer expedition isn't all that reliable either. There is no voice chat in Elden Ring Nightreign , for one thing, thereby limiting the amount of coordination a team can truly have. But what it really comes down to is how heavily each run in the game relies on a team being perfect, or at least near so.

If just one player on a team is underskilled or simply gets lost, it can compromise an entire expedition in Elden Ring Nightreign . It doesn't necessarily mean that players won't eventually reach the session's Night Lord, but considering the fact that being defeated by a Night Lord still doesn't reward them with much more than they might have received had they perished on Day 1, a perfect team is absolutely necessary. No member of the team can afford someone not to do their job in Elden Ring Nightreign , especially considering how painful it is to walk away with next to nothing after so much work.

In a sense, Elden Ring Nightreign 's progression is similar to when someone recommends a television series to their friend, but they encourage their friend to tolerate the unimpressive first season because it only starts getting better in the second.

In light of all this, Elden Ring Nightreign just has some walls that many players might quickly decide are not worth climbing. Essentially, Elden Ring Nightreign 's best moments are locked behind first impressions, and it's currently struggling to deliver in that arena. After a few hours of realizing just how unrewarding, tedious, and unbalanced the game can be, many players are likely to quit before things really start picking up.

item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign Players Want Changes to Frustrating Reviving Mechanic
item.description:
Summary

  • Players call for changes to Elden Rin Nightreign's revival mechanic.
  • Reviving process interruption leads to bar reset, making it difficult to revive teammates in Nightreign.
  • Suggestions include establishing checkpoints during reviving process.

Elden Ring Nightreign players are already calling for changes to one of the gameâ€™s core co-op mechanics, reviving teammates. FromSoftware's latest title, Elden Ring Nightreign , is a new action RPG that builds upon the foundation of the original Elden Ring , but with many roguelike mechanics.

Elden Ring stands as one of FromSoftwareâ€™s most acclaimed franchises, with the main game earning numerous prestigious awards, including Game of the Year at The Game Awards 2022. Building on this success, FromSoftware released the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC that expanded the world and introduced new characters, so itâ€™s no surprise that expectations were high when Nightreign was officially announced in December 2024.

Elden Ring Nightreign has received mixed reviews since launch, as many players continue to struggle with adapting to the gameâ€™s different playstyle. One feature that players are asking to be reworked is the revival mechanic. Unlike the original Elden Ring game, players in Nightreign can revive their teammates after theyâ€™re knocked down. This mechanic is similar to revival systems in other co-op games, especially in the battle royale genre. When a player is knocked down, a three-part revival bar appears above their character. Attacking the fallen ally reduces this bar, and once fully depleted, the Nightfarer can continue fighting. One of the main complaints is that it currently takes too many hits to complete the revival.

Elden Ring Nightreign Players Suggest Changes to Reviving Mechanic

Another criticism is that if the reviving process is interrupted, the bar begins to refill after just a few seconds. This forces players to continuously attack their downed teammate to keep the bar from resetting. Several players have pointed out that one of the most frustrating aspects of the mechanic is being forced to abandon a revive attempt, whether due to dodging an Elden Ring Nightreign boss attack or getting hit, only to see all their progress reversed.

Additionally, players note that after a teammate in Elden Ring Nightreign is knocked down for the third time, reviving them becomes nearly impossible due to the time it takes to deplete all three bars. Some suggest that each bar should act as a checkpoint, so that once two segments are cleared, only the remaining bar should recharge.

As roguelike games typically require frequent balancing, especially post-launch, Elden Ring Nightreign is expected to receive regular adjustments. FromSoftware also previously announced several substantial updates for Elden Ring Nightreign , most of which are focused on improving solo play. The studio has also announced a DLC release in Q4 2025, which will be free for players who own the Deluxe Edition.

item.title: Hell is Us Reveals PC System Requirements
item.description:
Summary

  • Hell is Us PC system requirements range from minimum to ultra tiers for different in-game performances.
  • The game requires specific CPU-GPU combos and 16GB RAM along with 30GB SSD storage.
  • Rogue Factor clarified the 30 FPS on the RTX 4090 GPU to manage expectations and avoid overpromising.

Hell is Us has revealed its PC systems requirements for a range of different tiers offering varying levels of in-game performance. Developed by Rogue Factor and published by Nacon, Hell is Us is scheduled to roll out on September 4, 2025, on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X/S.

First unveiled in 2022, Hell is Us is an action-adventure game that has been brewing behind the scenes for quite some time now. It was originally slated for a 2023 arrival before being pushed back by two years. Earlier in 2025, Rogue Factor finally locked down a release date for Hell is Us and also showed more of its gameplay, from combat to exploration. With only a few months to go, interested gamers have been preparing for the semi-open world title's launch. In the same spirit, the devs recently shared various tiers and system specifications to help PC players get an idea of the game's expected performance on their respective rigs.

In a new announcement, Hell is Us laid out the PC specifications for running the game on different performance tiers, all the way from Minimum to Ultra. Those looking to run the game on the lowest tier, which promises 1080p 30 FPS performance at medium settings, will need a CPU-GPU combo of i7-7700K/Ryzen 3 3300X and GTX 1070 8GB/RX 5600 XT 6GB. On the other hand, those looking for an optimal performance of 1080p 60 FPS gameplay at high settings should have i7-11700K/Ryzen 5 7600 and RTX 2080Ti 11GB/RX 6750 XT 12GB. Upgrading the GPU with RTX 4090 24GB/RX 7900 XTX 24GB should offer players the best-possible Hell is Us gameplay experience, with 4K 30FPS performance at ultra settings. Across these system configurations, 16GB RAM and 30GB SSD storage are a consistent requirement for all users.

Hell is Us offering a frame-rate of only 30 FPS on the high-end RTX 4090 24GB GPU, which concerned some players. To address this concern, the Rogue Factor team released a statement on Steam and clarified that it mentioned "4K 30 FPS" for this particular GPU because, even though the frame-rate will possibly go higher, it still may not deliver a consistent 60 FPS. The Hell is Us studio reasoned that it wanted to be "realistic" and steer clear from "overpromising."

It has been over three years since the initial Hell is Us announcement and players are understandably raring to finally play the game. When it comes out this September, it will be interesting to see how similar or different its gameplay is compared to Soulslike titles, a genre that Rogue Factor's forthcoming game has been likened to before.

item.title: New Game Releasing June 10 is Something GTA Fans Will Want to Check Out
item.description:
Summary

  • MindsEye, directed by Leslie Benzies, releases on June 10.
  • The game features shooting and driving similar to the GTA games, which Benzies worked on for years.
  • But while GTA is a massive open world game, MindsEye is focused on a more linear action experience.

MindsEye is an impressive-looking new action game set to launch on June 10 that should be of interest to fans of Rockstar's Grand Theft Auto franchise. MindsEye was first revealed back in 2022, and it's just now nearing its release date. Originating as part of the ambitious Everywhere game platform, MindsEye is directed by former Rockstar exec Leslie Benzies and will be the first game he's shipped since Grand Theft Auto 5 launched all the way back in 2013.

Benzies was a key figure at Rockstar since the company's earliest days, serving as a producer on the groundbreaking Grand Theft Auto 3 and playing major roles in subsequent entries in the blockbuster franchise. Benzies had a hand in many of Rockstar's other high-profile releases, including Manhunt , Bully , the first Red Dead Redemption game, and Max Payne 3 . Benzies' departure from Rockstar and Take-Two in 2016 wasn't pretty, resulting in a years-long legal battle that didn't end until 2019.

Benzies' history of working on some of the most-beloved video games of all time has raised expectations for MindsEye . Releasing on June 10 for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X, MindsEye gameplay has painted a picture of a futuristic, sci-fi spin on GTA -like action, but in the form of a more linear action game experience as opposed to a massive open world. Graphically, MindsEye looks stellar, and it seems to feature a healthy mix of shooting and driving. It may not be the exact same as a new GTA game, but MindsEye should still appeal to fans of the franchise and could very well help fill the void left by GTA 6 being delayed to 2026.

MindsEye Has Serious GTA Vibes

MindsEye gameplay trailers have made the game look nothing short of an action-packed spectacle, though time will tell if it lives up to expectations. Benzies' track record is incredible and may make people expect too much from new studio Build a Rocket Boy's first effort. Then again, MindsEye could very well be a smash hit and go above and beyond what people are hoping to see from it. Luckily, the wait to find out if MindsEye lives up to Benzies' past work will be a short one, as the game's launch is right around the corner.

MindsEye is launching on June 10, and those that pre-order will get some extra goodies. MindsEye pre-orders get deluxe content at no added cost, including the Premium Pass (which includes a Horde Mode and new missions/challenges to be added in the months ahead), vehicle and drone skins, and a special "Future" skin for protagonist Jacob Diaz.

item.title: Clash Royale: Best Archer Queen Decks
item.description:
Champion cards have totally changed the way we build decks in Clash Royale . Unlike regular cards, they have a special ability that players can activate to catch their opponents off guard. For example, Goblinstein can zap and stun enemies with his lightning link, while Mighty Miner switches lanes and drops a bomb when he does.

Archer Queen is one of the strongest Champion cards in Clash Royale . With just a tap, she can go invisible and attack super fast. If you want to build a solid deck around Archer Queen, here's a look at some of the best ones out there.

What Does Archer Queen Do in Clash Royale?

Archer Queen costs 5 elixir and unlocks when you reach the Royal Crypt (Arena 17) . She shoots arrows at both air and ground troops, like regular Archers but way stronger.

What makes her really special is her ability called Cloaking Cap . When the player activates it, she turns invisible for 3.5 seconds and shoots 180% faster . This makes her great for taking down big tanks and surprising your opponent.

Best Archer Queen Decks in Clash Royale

Royal Hogs Archer Queen Cannon Deck

Apart from Royal Hogs and Archer Queen, all the other cards cost 3 elixir or less, so you can cycle through your cards quickly. For Evolutions, we recommend choosing Ice Spirit and Cannon.

This deck is also very popular in the current meta. Youâ€™ve got Prince, Wall Breakers, and Bandit for strong pushes that can quickly pressure your opponent. On defense, Mega Knight, Goblin Gang, and Archer Queen can shut down pretty much anything. Arrows and Zap can help players clear out annoying swarm units and low-health troops like Dart Goblin or Firecracker.
